hint.text:
Irreducible factors cannot be broken down further.
Eg: \(x(2x+4y)\) can still be further reduced to \(2x(x+2y).\)

solution.text:
\(_{{2*l}}_x = _{{2*l}}_ \times x, _{{6*l}}_y = 3 \times _{{2*l}}_ \times y \), hence, _{{2*l}}_ is a common factor for both terms
Using distributive law,
\(_{{2*l}}_x + _{{6*l}}_y = _{{2*l}}_(x+3y)\)
